You're on the right track! Strengthening your glutes and lower back can indeed help alleviate tension in your hamstrings, especially the left one that's been giving you trouble.

The hamstring muscle group is closely connected to the glutes and lower back, so it's not uncommon for weakness or imbalance in these areas to contribute to hamstring tightness or strain. By incorporating exercises that target your glutes and lower back, you can help:

1. **Improve hip and pelvic alignment**: Strengthening your glutes can help stabilize your pelvis and hip joint, reducing the strain on your hamstrings.
2. **Enhance muscle balance**: Building strength in your glutes and lower back can help balance out the strength and flexibility of your hamstring muscles, reducing the risk of overuse or strain.
3. **Increase proprioception**: Strengthening these areas can also improve your body awareness and proprioception (your ability to sense the position and movement of your body), which can help you maintain better alignment and movement patterns.

Some exercises you can try to strengthen your glutes and lower back include:

* Glute bridges: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, then lift your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top.
* Planks: Hold a plank position for 30-60 seconds to engage your core, lower back, and glutes.
* Pelvic tilts: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, then tilt your pelvis upwards and back down again, repeating the motion.
* Bird dog: Start on your hands and knees, then lift your right arm and left leg off the ground, holding for a few seconds before switching sides.
* Superman: Lie on your stomach with arms extended in front of you, then lift your arms, shoulders, and legs off the ground, holding for a few seconds.

Remember to start slowly and gently, especially if you're new to these exercises. It's also essential to listen to your body and stop if you experience any pain or discomfort.

In addition to incorporating these exercises, don't forget to maintain your regular hamstring stretching routine and focus on proper alignment and movement patterns in your yoga practice.

How does that sound? Are you ready to give it a try?
